nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Information Content
nodes.description: The method uses shared information content that is informtion content of the concepts' parents (in the hierarchy) to determine the similarity between them.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Semantic Similarity in a Taxonomy: An Information-Based Measure and its Application to Problems of Ambiguity in Natural Language

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Tree-based similarity
nodes.description: The Lin's measure presents the similarity as the ration between the LCS IC and the sum of IC of considered concepts.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: An Information-Theoretic Definition of Similarity

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Edge-based - AHMD Value
nodes.description: We first evaluate the functional relationships among genes from three different perspectives: one based on GO assignments and the other two based on comparative genome analysis. We, then, combine these different measures by using a Bayesian inference to predict functional modules.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Prediction of functional modules based on comparative genome analysis and Gene Ontology application

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Edge-based - Pozo et al.
nodes.description: We propose a new method to derive 'functional distances' between GO terms that is based on the simultaneous occurrence of terms in the same set of Interpro entries, instead of relying on the structure of the GO.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Defining functional distances over Gene Ontology

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Edge-based - IntelliGO
nodes.description: We present here a new semantic similarity measure called IntelliGO which integrates several complementary properties in a novel vector space model. The coefficients associated with each GO term that annotates a given gene or protein include its information content as well as a customized value for each type of GO evidence code. The generalized cosine similarity measure, used for calculating the dot product between two vectors, has been rigorously adapted to the context of the GO graph.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: IntelliGO: a new vector-based semantic similarity measure including annotation origin

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Edge-based - "Tree Ascending" classification algorithm
nodes.description: Proposing a “tree ascending” classification algorithm which extends the kNN method by making use of the taxonomic similarity between nearest neighbors.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Taxonomy learning. Proceedings of the 19th international conference on Computational linguistics

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Feature-based - Rodriguez et al
nodes.description: An approach to computing semantic similarity that relaxes the requirement of a single ontology and accounts for differences in the levels of explicitness and formalization of the different ontology specifications. A similarity function determines similar entity classes by using a matching process over synonym sets, semantic neighborhoods, and distinguishing features that are classified into parts, functions, and attributes.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Determining semantic similarity among entity classes from different ontologies

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Feature-based - X-Similarity
nodes.description: X-Similarity relies on matching between synsets and term description sets. The term description sets contain words extracted by parsing term definitions (“glosses” in WordNet or “scope notes” in MeSH). Two terms are similar if their synsets or description sets or, the synsets of the terms in their neighborhood (e.g., more specific and more general terms) are lexically similar.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: X-Similarity: Computing Semantic Similarity between Concepts from Different Ontologies

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Feature-based - Contrast Model of Similarity
nodes.description: Similarity of the objects as linear combination or a contrast of the measures of their common and disctinctive features. He defines similarity as a matching process. He also introduced less known ration model where he describest similarity as a function of common features devided by the number of all common and disjunctive features of both stimuli.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Features of Similarity

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Hybrid - Wang et al.
nodes.description: GO term is turned into a numeric string and then the similarity is calculated based on them.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: A new method to measure the semantic similarity of GO terms

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Hybrid - Othman et al.
nodes.description: The genetic similarity algorithm combines semantic similarity measure algorithm with parallel genetic algorithm. The semantic similarity measure algorithm is used to compute the similitude strength between the Gene Ontology terms. Then, the parallel genetic algorithm is employed to perform batch retrieval and to accelerate the search in large search space of the Gene Ontology graph.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: A genetic similarity algorithm for searching the Gene Ontology terms and annotating anonymous protein sequences

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Hybrid - Knappe
nodes.description: Similarity method based on decomposition, upwards expansion and aggregation of possible paths between concepts based on the notion of shared nodes.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: On similarity measures for content-based querying

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Hybrid -  Zhou et al.
nodes.description: The model takes the path length between two concepts and IC value of each concept as its metric, furthermore, the weight of two metrics can be adapted artificially

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: New model of semantic similarity measuring in wordnet

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - GraSM - Graph-based Similarity Measure
nodes.description: When calculating the semantic similarity of two concepts, GraSM selects the disjunctive common ancestors rather than only using the most informative common ancestor.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Semantic Similarity over the Gene Ontology: Family Correlation and Selecting Disjunctive Ancestors

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Schlicker et al.
nodes.description: The method relies on two semantic similarity measures; simRel and funSim. One measure (simRel) is applied in the comparison of the biological processes found in different groups of organisms. The other measure (funSim) is used to find functionally related gene products within the same or between different genomes.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: A new measure for functional similarity of gene products based on Gene Ontology

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Semantic Signature
nodes.description: Proposing new way of representing semantic meaning "Semantic Signature" + 3 methods for comparing these signatures; a unified approach to semantic similarity across multiple representation levels from senses to documents; unified representation of the meaning of an arbitrarily-sized piece of text, referred to as a lexical item, using a sense-based probability distribution; alignment-based method for word sense disambiguation.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Align, Disambiguate, and Walk: Random walks on Semantic Networks

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Maguitman et al.
nodes.description: It measures similarity in similar way as Lin's method, but it generalizes it into ontology concept. The LCS for example is defined by adding weights to different types of connections and measuring the total score.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Algorithmic Detection of Semantic Similarity

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Node-based - Jiang and Conrath
nodes.description: The distance between concepts in this method is the difference between sum of the information content of those two concepts and information content of the closest parent that subsumes them both.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Semantic Similarity Based on Corpus Statistics and Lexical Taxonomy

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Semantic - MP
nodes.description: First decomposing the concepts into semantic primes, then incorporating filtering out the terms that have not been activated by at least two of the start activations.Then it's normalised by the number of start activation to obtain semantic distance.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Design and Use of a Semantic Similarity Measure for Interoperability Among Agents

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - TBK
nodes.description: It is ratio between distance from root to closest common ancestor of 2 terms and the path between terms routed through root node. Minus a Penalty Function (which penalizes only neighboring nodes).

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: A New Similarity Measure based on Edge Counting

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - Shortest Path
nodes.description: It is measured by subtracting the shortest path between the concepts in the hierarchy from doubled longest path in the hierarchy between the concepts.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Development and application of a metric on semantic nets

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - Wu and Palmer
nodes.description: Ratio between the doubled distance from most specific comon concept to the root concept and sum of distances between the concepts and most specific comon concept and agan doubled distance from most specific comon concept to the root concept.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Verbs semantics and lexical selection

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - Weighted Links
nodes.description: Information content of the first class in the noun hierarchy that subsumes both classes.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Using WordNet as a knowledge base for measuring semantic similarity between words

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - Li et. al
nodes.description: Non linear function combining taxonomy depth, shortest path between concepts and a "semantic vector" to calculate similarity with arbitrary weights defined by the user.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: An approach for measuring semantic similarity between words using multiple information sources

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - Leacock and Chodorow
nodes.description: Calculates similarity as a log of, divided by doubled max hierarchy depth, shortest path between the terms.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Filling in a sparse training space for word sense identification

nodes.label: Method
nodes.name: Structure-based - HSO
nodes.description: It calculates relatedness between concepts using the path distance between the concept nodes, number of changes in direction of the path connecting two concepts and the allowableness of the path. If there is a close relation between meanings of two concepts or words, then the concepts are said to be semantically related to each other.

nodes.label: Reference
nodes.title: Lexical chains as representations of context for the detection and correction of malapropisms
